Sentencas: Developing high-performance cathodes with sufficient stability against CO2 rooting in ambient atmosphere is crucial to realizing the practical application of solid-oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Tuning the Phase Transition of SrFeO3-δ by Mn toward Enhanced Catalytic Activity and CO2 Resistance for the Oxygen Reduction Reaction

Sentencas: Herein, the Mn dopant is investigated to regulate the phase structure and cathode performance of SrFeO(3-delta )perovskites through partially replacing the B-site Fe.
Titulo: Tuning the Phase Transition of SrFeO3-δ by Mn toward Enhanced Catalytic Activity and CO2 Resistance for the Oxygen Reduction Reaction

Sentencas: Compared with parent SrFeO3-delta, Mn-doped materials, SrFe1-xMnxO3-delta (x = 0.05 and 0.1), show stabilized cubic perovskites at room temperature.
Titulo: Tuning the Phase Transition of SrFeO3-δ by Mn toward Enhanced Catalytic Activity and CO2 Resistance for the Oxygen Reduction Reaction

Sentencas: Meanwhile, doping Mn accelerates the oxygen reduction reaction process, showing a reduced polarization resistance of 0.155 Omega.cm(2) at 700 degrees C for SrFe0.95Mn0.05O3-delta, which is less than 30% of SrFeO3-delta.
Titulo: Tuning the Phase Transition of SrFeO3-δ by Mn toward Enhanced Catalytic Activity and CO2 Resistance for the Oxygen Reduction Reaction

Sentencas: In addition, the Mn dopant improves the chemical oxygen surface exchange and bulk diffusion coefficients.
Titulo: Tuning the Phase Transition of SrFeO3-δ by Mn toward Enhanced Catalytic Activity and CO2 Resistance for the Oxygen Reduction Reaction

Sentencas: Furthermore, Mn enhances the tolerance toward CO2 corrosion in various CO2 atmospheres.
Titulo: Tuning the Phase Transition of SrFeO3-δ by Mn toward Enhanced Catalytic Activity and CO2 Resistance for the Oxygen Reduction Reaction

Sentencas: Density functional theory calculations also reveal that Mn can strengthen the structural stability and increase the activity for the oxygen reduction reaction.
Titulo: Tuning the Phase Transition of SrFeO3-δ by Mn toward Enhanced Catalytic Activity and CO2 Resistance for the Oxygen Reduction Reaction
